pages.text: Welcome to the Matador Come in and be enveloped by our passion for the most daring of spirits. For brave, fresh Mexican flavors, and beautiful scratch-made cocktails. For the people and the culture of Mexico, where we forge friendships with tequila makers, listen to their stories, and bring them home to share with you, as we guide you through your tequila experience. Choose from the most diverse selection of tequilas you’ll find anywhere—in a space filled with furnishings and fittings inspired by our travels, and crafted by our founder’s own hands. Join us. We invite you to become a part of the journey. Taste Mexico Reimagined The Matador uses all-natural ingredients only, and that includes our carne, pollo, carnitas and seafood. We source the freshest, in-season vegetables and fruits available. Then we take those ingredients and cook them up into creative dishes that taste a bit like Mexico, a bit like the local area, and a bit like nothing you’ve ever tasted before. Please click to see our current takeout menu, including our Take n Bake dishes, Familia meals, and beverages to go. (gf) Choose From: Marinated Carne Asada* Chile-Seasoned Ribeye* ~Make it surf and turf, add habanero, Chile-garlic or poblano shrimp~ Shrimp & Chorizo Paella Shrimp, house-made chorizo, sautéed fajita peppers, achiote-chile rice, saffron cream Mango-Pineapple Mahi Mahi Chunky mango & pineapple salsa, fruity salsa verde, serrano slaw, chile-achiote rice, cilantro, lime Roasted Chile Rellenos Poblanos stuﬀed with Mexican rice, Monterey Jack cheese, tomatillo salsa served with Mexican black beans, poblano crema, garlic crema, pico de gallo, and tortilla strips Choose from: Shredded Chicken, Beyond Picadillo, or Carnitas (gf) We Know Tequila Drinking tequila is like drinking in the essence of Mexico. The Matador believes there’s a perfect tequila for every person and every occasion, and we love nothing more than helping our guests discover theirs. We’ve curated a collection of more than 150 tequilas that we feel are truly excellent, from all over Mexico. Some are available exclusively at the Matador. We even serve our own Private Reserve Tequila—from barrels we select personally after tastings with the makers in Mexico. This gives you endless ways to experience the fun of this wild and extraordinary spirit, and the nuances of the different regions of Mexico where it’s produced. Try a margarita made with our own fresh, house-made sour mix, or one of our many other creative cocktails crafted by our in-house mixologist. Let us guide you through a flight, to discover something new and intriguing. Or just savor a beautiful shot of your all-time favorite. Want free nachos?! Join our (free) loyalty program and receive an order of our standard Grande Nachos when you download The Matador app! Plus earn points for every dollar spent, get a free dessert on your birthday & more! Sign Up Now Locations The Matador may be slightly mysterious, but we’re not hard to find. To connect with a specific restaurant, please select a location. Ballard Matador Boise Matador SE Portland Matador Meridian Matador NW Portland Matador Redmond Matador 21+ Tacoma Matador 21+ West Seattle Matador 21+ N Portland Matador Charleston Matador Charlotte Matador Greenville Matador About Us At the Matador, tequila is more than a beverage—it’s almost a culture of its own. We immerse ourselves in it. We know the landscape and the people who make a difference within it. We love everything about tequila, and we enjoy sharing our knowledge, to help our guests appreciate it as much as we do. We serve a menu of scratch-made dishes that complement the nuances of great blancos, reposados and añejos, with exciting preparations that re-think Mexican, always fresh ingredients and creative plate presentations. The restaurant interiors reflect the craft, heart, soul and sense of adventure that live inside every good bottle of tequila. Step into the Matador, and gain insider access to the world of tequila, the flavorful foods that go with it and the rarified atmosphere of craft, care and pleasure it creates. Cater Your Event Click below to see our outside catering menus. Whether ordering lunch for the office, or a taco bar for a special event, we've got you covered. Order Catering Online Hosted Events Tucked away from the crowd, the Matador offers several unique private spaces for you and your group. We’ll help you with all the details for a perfect event, whether you’re planning a gathering of friends and family, a business luncheon, a professional workshop, or even a tequila tasting seminar. Take a look at our in-house catering menus: Catering Menu Our Event Venues We have many wonderful options in the Seattle, Portland, Charleston, and Boise areas. Mezcals are an older and more traditional form of agave spirit and tend to have stronger, more intense flavor profiles than tequilas. Approachable For the beginners. Espadín and other milder agaves produce mezcals with gentle charred agave sweetness, moderate citrus, tropical fruit, burnt hardwoods, and earth. Exotic For the curious. Cristalinos are aged tequilas that have been filtered to remove colors and heavier wood notes that come from barrel-aging, resulting in a tequila with the complexity of an añejo but with the bright notes and color of a blanco. Mezcals are an older and more traditional form of agave spirit and tend to have stronger, more intense flavor profiles than tequilas. Approachable For the beginners. Espadín and other milder agaves produce mezcals with gentle charred agave sweetness, moderate citrus, tropical fruit, burnt hardwoods, and earth. Exotic For the curious. Wild-harvested agaves and single village bottlings have very unique flavor profiles and strongly express their terroir, producing varied notes of vegetation, earth, mineral, fruits, citrus, spice and herbs. Artisanal For the bold. Rare agaves and traditional production techniques produce incredibly complex mezcals with a wide array of pungent aromas and intense flavors. Approachable For the beginners. Cristalinos are aged tequilas that have been filtered to remove colors and heavier wood notes that come from barrel-aging, resulting in a tequila with the complexity of an añejo but with the bright notes and color of a blanco. underground pits, giving mezcals the smokiness they are known for. Mezcals are an older and more traditional form of agave spirit and tend to have stronger, more intense flavor profiles than tequilas. Approachable For the beginners. Espadín and other milder agaves produce mezcals with gentle charred agave sweetness, moderate citrus, tropical fruit, burnt hardwoods, and earth. Advanced For the curious. Wild-harvested agaves and single village bottlings have very unique flavor profiles and strongly express their terroir, producing varied notes of vegetation, earth, mineral, fruits, citrus, spice, and herbs. Exotic For the bold. Rare agaves and ancestral production techniques produce incredibly complex mezcals with a wide array of pungent aromas and intense flavors. Approachable For the beginners. Mezcals are an older and more traditional form of agave spirit and tend to have stronger, more intense flavor profiles than tequilas. Approachable For the beginners. Espadín and other milder agaves produce mezcals with gentle charred agave sweetness, moderate citrus, tropical fruit, burnt hardwoods, and earth. Exotic For the curious. Wild-harvested agaves and single village bottlings have very unique flavor profiles and strongly express their terroir, producing varied notes of vegetation, earth, mineral, fruits, citrus, spice and herbs. Artisanal For the bold. Rare agaves and traditional production techniques produce incredibly complex mezcals with a wide array of pungent aromas and intense flavors. Approachable For the beginners. Cristalinos are aged tequilas that have been filtered to remove colors and heavier wood notes that come from barrel-aging, resulting in a tequila with the complexity of an añejo but with the bright notes and color of a blanco. Espadín and other milder agaves produce mezcals with gentle charred agave sweetness, moderate citrus, tropical fruit, burnt hardwoods, and earth. Advanced For the curious. Private Events Tucked away from the crowd, the Matador offers several unique private spaces for you and your group. We’ll help you with all the details for a perfect event, whether you’re planning a gathering of friends and family, a business luncheon, a professional workshop, or even a tequila tasting seminar. We have many wonderful options in the Seattle, Portland, Boise and South Carolina areas. See the venues available near you, and inquire about hosting your event with us! The Ballroom and the Mezcaleria each offer their own unique style and amenities, providing the perfect backdrop for any occasion from meetings to celebrations. Choose from our many customized menus for sit-down dinners and buffet-style entertaining. We provide one or more servers for every gathering, so you can relax and enjoy the company of your guests, our delicious food and drinks, and the intimate, exciting and fun atmosphere of our Ballard location. Mezcals are an older and more traditional form of agave spirit and tend to have stronger, more intense flavor profiles than tequilas. Approachable For the beginners. Espadín and other milder agaves produce mezcals with gentle charred agave sweetness, moderate citrus, tropical fruit, burnt hardwoods, and earth. Exotic For the curious. Wild-harvested agaves and single village bottlings have very unique flavor profiles and strongly express their terroir, producing varied notes of vegetation, earth, mineral, fruits, citrus, spice and herbs. Artisanal For the bold. Rare agaves and traditional production techniques produce incredibly complex mezcals with a wide array of pungent aromas and intense flavors. Approachable For the beginners. Cristalinos are aged tequilas that have been filtered to remove colors and heavier wood notes that come from barrel-aging, resulting in a tequila with the complexity of an añejo but with the bright notes and color of a blanco. Matador Charleston The Matador is located in the heart of downtown Charleston. Here, we celebrate Mexico's flavors and the world of tequila and agave spirits. The menu features scratch-made dishes using the freshest seasonal produce, seafoods, and meats and the tequila list is extensive, with something to suit every taste. The restaurant's interior is stylish, sophisticated, warm, and inviting. On weekends, experience our upstairs Mezcaleria bar or grab a seat on our rooftop patio. The staff is knowledgeable about tequila and Mexican-inspired cuisine, and they are ready to guide your experience to help you find your perfect drink and dish. Whether you're a tequila connoisseur or just looking for a delicious meal, The Matador is the perfect place to experience the best of Mexico!
